column5: Just finishing up console of boat and decided to recess a square area which will eventually have a plexiglass door with breathing holes etc...  Anyways I'm looking for thin plastic corner molding to clean it all up.  I've seen 1/2" plastic corners at home depot etc. and have seen the rubber stuff for bathtub/sink corners but not exactly what I had in mind.  Any ideas would be appreciated.  I've included 2 images - one of rocker panel and one of my idea...  Basically cutting the top off a plastic waste basket exactly 9" X 12" would be perfect but the dollar store isn't taking custom requests!

I would go with an aluminium J mold using the long side on the inner wall of the recess. Aluminium can be cut with wood blades so getting your miters shouldn't be too much trouble on a miter saw. http://www.eagle-aluminum.com/Aluminum-J-Cap--curved-face-drip-rail_p_186.html
Look at a washing machine box they come in a few different sizes and the lip edge will look good.    Art
Yep, either J Mold or 1/2" angle will work fine.
